review: I feel this is a great product for the price. While it differs from the AppleTV (lacks a remote, and has no GUI with all of the accounts in one place, music channels(?)), I find it still succeeds in serving its purpose. I generally know which app or two I am going to use when I approach my TV, so I pull those up on the phone and fire up the Chromecast with ease.The one downside is that it may have a few apps that are not compatible yet. Several app updates came out just before I purchased mine to allow it to work with it, and I'm sure in no time that more apps will accommodate it. And for the record, I did have complications on initial install (forced to do a firmware update that never seemed to connect to it a server), however after reading a few forums, found the solution. I do not count this as a negative for the product due to the fact that I've heard of several other products with the same problem of getting connectivity on a home network (smart light bulbs, blu-ray players, etc).

author: Ramesh K

review: What a great little gadget that works WITH your phone.  I originally bought the Apple TV for $100.00.  I took it with me on vacation and forgot the remote and thought I could download an app and use that.  Not so!  I even called Tech Support who confirmed no such app worked at that time.  So I was out of luck.  With this steaming player, I use my PHONE so no remote is necessary and I just connect to the wifi with my phone and presto- it works!!  Can't wait to travel and see if I can get it to work at the hotel.  Still all and all it works much better then the Apple TV and with the third of the price, this baby is a no brainer!!!

review: It works well with the iPad and MacBook Air. I wish there were more functions and apps available but maybe Google will roll out with more things for Chromecast. I also wish it was easier to switch TVs or taking it on the go (i.e. making profiles for each TV connected before or something of the sort). I love that it has Netflix on it when I use this on a "dumb" TV. I didn't want to spend a bunch of money on AppleTV and I don't think I will switch to it anytime soon.
